reference.title: Creating Documents
reference.shortdesc: You can create CWRC-Writer documents in two ways, either by uploading a file or by using a preexisting template (provided by CWRC). Additionally, these options are customizable because you select which schema to use.

section.title: General Information
section.p: To upload a document you must first create a folder in CWRC (please see instructions below). Then, you must choose to add a new document in the folder by clicking on the “Manage tab.”

Users have the option to either upload a document From File or open a template provided by CWRC by selecting From Template.Regardless of which uploading option you select, CWRC-Writer allows you to add more information about the document you are creating. The only required information, however, is the object's title.

section.title: Upload from file
section.p: When uploading any document, make sure that it is a well-formed XML and that the document ends in an.xml name extension. If the document is not a well-formed XML document or does not have the .xml file name extension, then you cannot upload it.
You can customize your document by choosing the schema it follows from a drop down menu.

section.title: From a template
section.p: Templates are already available from CWRC and Orlando, and are well-formed XML documents. Templates are stored in the CWRC Document Template Collection. Additionally, these templates already have an associated schema attached (making it easier for XML beginners).
